get.description:
Returns the matching locations for the given parameters. Either query or ( x and y ) are required.

The locations in the response are scored to determine which is the most exact location.

This method can return a refine response, what means that the request has to be redone.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Specifies the location name to search for (e.g. Basel)

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Latitude (e.g. 47.476001)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Longitude (e.g. 8.306130)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Only with `query` parameter. Specifies the location type, possible types are:
  • `all` (default): Looks up for all types of locations
  • `station`: Looks up for stations (train station, bus station)
  • `poi`: Looks up for points of interest (Clock tower, China garden)
  • `address`: Looks up for an address (Zurich Bahnhofstrasse 33)

get.description: Returns the next connections from a location to another.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Specifies the departure location of the connection (e.g. Lausanne)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Specifies the arrival location of the connection (e.g. Genève)

parameters.name: via[]
parameters.description: Specifies up to five via locations. When specifying several vias, array notation (via[]=Bern&via[]=Fribourg) is required

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date of the connection, in the format YYYY-MM-DD (e.g. 2012-03-25)

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time of the connection, in the format hh:mm (e.g. 17:30)

parameters.name: isArrivalTime
parameters.description: defaults to `0`, if set to `1` the passed `date` and `time` is the arrival time

parameters.name: transportations[]
parameters.description: Transportation means; one or more of `train`, `tram`, `ship`, `bus`, `cableway` (e.g. transportations[]=tram&transportations[]=bus)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 1 - 6. Specifies the number of connections to return. If several connections depart at the same time they are counted as 1.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: 0 - 10. Allows pagination of connections. Zero-based, so first page is 0, second is 1, third is 2 and so on.

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: defaults to `0`, if set to `1` only direct connections are allowed

parameters.name: sleeper
parameters.description: defaults to `0`, if set to `1` only night trains containing beds are allowed, implies `direct=1`

parameters.name: couchette
parameters.description: defaults to `0`, if set to `1` only night trains containing couchettes are allowed, implies `direct=1`

parameters.name: bike
parameters.description: defaults to `0`, if set to `1` only trains allowing the transport of bicycles are allowed

parameters.name: accessibility
parameters.description: Possible values are `independent_boarding`, `assisted_boarding`, and `advanced_notice`

get.description: Returns the next connections leaving from a specific location.

parameters.name: station
parameters.description: Specifies the location of which a stationboard should be returned (e.g. Aarau)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the station whose stationboard should be returned. Alternative to the station parameter; one of these two is required. If both an id and a station are specified the id has precedence. e.g. 8503059 (for Zurich Stadelhofen)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of departing connections to return. This is not a hard limit - if multiple connections leave at the same time it'll return any connections that leave at the same time as the last connection within the limit. For example: `limit=4` will return connections leaving at: 19:30, 19:32, 19:32, 19:35, 19:35. Because one of the connections leaving at 19:35 is within the limit, all connections leaving at 19:35 are shown.

parameters.name: transportations[]
parameters.description: Transportation means; one or more of `train`, `tram`, `ship`, `bus`, `cableway` (e.g. transportations[]=tram&transportations[]=bus)

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description: Date and time of departing connections, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm` (e.g. 2012-03-25 17:30)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `departure` (default) or `arrival`

station.description: The first matched location based on the query. The stationboard will be displayed if this is a station.

stationboard.description: A list of journeys with the stop of the line leaving from that station.

type.description: The type of the given coordinate.

score.description: The score with regard to the search request, the higher the better.

distance.description: If search has been with coordinates, distance to original point in meters.
